title: Nonsense makes no sense
excerpt: Here’s something that’s obvious and easily overlooked: if your notes aren't clear, sharing them is pointless.

children.text: Here’s something that’s obvious and easily overlooked: if your notes aren't clear, sharing them is pointless.

I know people who struggle to write things that are understandable for anyone but themselves. Which, of course, is a major hassle, because no one has the the time to decipher what it is they’re saying.
To create readable content for others, it’s best to write clearly and provide context as you go. To assess what it is you’re saying as you say it.
It’s certainly a skill that takes time to master, but it's an essential one to have.
At the the end of the day, your notes are only as useful as they are easy to interpret—not just for others but, more importantly, for your future self.
